definitions: military force of citizens organized for emergency defense who are not professional soldiers
examples: The colonial militia gathered to defend their settlements from attack
Local militia units trained every weekend at the town armory

definitions: person who delivers milk and dairy products to homes
examples: The milkman arrived early every morning with fresh bottles
Our neighborhood milkman retired after thirty years of service

definitions: cold sweet drink made by blending milk with ice cream and flavorings
examples: She ordered a chocolate milkshake with extra whipped cream
The diner serves thick milkshakes in tall frosted glasses

definitions: tall plant with milky juice and clusters of small flowers that monarch butterflies depend on
examples: Monarch caterpillars only eat milkweed leaves for survival
The garden includes milkweed to attract butterflies every summer

definitions: period of one thousand years or anniversary marking such a period
examples: The new millennium began with celebrations around the world
Archaeological evidence dates back several millennia before recorded history

definitions: person who owns or operates a mill for grinding grain
examples: The village miller ground wheat into flour for bread
The old miller taught his son the family trade

definitions: small round grain grown as food crop in warm regions with poor soil
examples: Farmers in dry regions often grow millet instead of wheat
The porridge was made from millet and served with honey

definitions: unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter
examples: The gap measured exactly five millimeters in width
Precision instruments can measure distances to the nearest millimeter

definitions: unit of length equal to one thousandth of a metre
examples: The surgeon made an incision just three millimetres long
Rain measurements are recorded in millimetres for weather reports

definitions: person who designs, makes, or sells women's hats
examples: The milliner created custom hats for the royal wedding
She apprenticed with a milliner to learn hat-making techniques

definitions: process of grinding grain into flour or meal
aimless movement of people or animals in a confined area
examples: The milling of wheat produces different grades of flour
Modern milling techniques preserve more nutrients than traditional methods
People were milling around the entrance waiting for doors to open
The cattle spent hours milling in the holding pen

definitions: person whose wealth equals or exceeds one million monetary units
examples: The tech entrepreneur became a millionaire before turning thirty
The lottery winner went from teacher to millionaire overnight

definitions: position number one million in a sequence
one part of something divided into one million equal parts
examples: She was the millionth visitor to the museum this year
The millionth digit of pi was recently calculated
A microsecond is one millionth of a second duration
The measurement was accurate to the millionth decimal place

definitions: worm-like creature with two pairs of legs on most body segments
examples: The millipede curled into a spiral when touched gently
Garden millipedes help decompose dead plant material in soil

definitions: unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second
examples: Computer processors execute instructions in mere milliseconds today
The race was decided by just twelve milliseconds difference

definitions: large flat circular stone used for grinding grain
heavy burden or obstacle that hinders progress or success
examples: The ancient millstone still grinds grain at the heritage site
Workers struggled to move the heavy millstone into position
Student debt became a millstone around her neck for years
The failing division was a millstone dragging down company profits

definitions: performer who acts without words using only gestures and expressions
art of conveying meaning through gestures without spoken words
examples: The street mime entertained crowds with invisible wall routines
She studied mime at the theater school in Paris
Children played mime games at the birthday party yesterday
The art of mime requires precise body control and expression

definitions: person who copies the speech, mannerisms, or behavior of others
examples: The talented mimic impersonated celebrities at the comedy show
Children are natural mimics who copy adult behaviors constantly

definitions: action or skill of copying sounds, movements, or appearance of someone or something
examples: The parrot's mimicry of human speech amazed zoo visitors
Some insects use mimicry to look like dangerous species

definitions: tropical plant with leaves that fold when touched and pink flowers
cocktail made with champagne and orange juice typically served at brunch
examples: The mimosa plant closed its leaves when the child touched them
Pink mimosa flowers bloomed throughout the greenhouse in spring
They ordered mimosas to celebrate at the Sunday brunch gathering
The restaurant serves bottomless mimosas during weekend brunch hours

definitions: abbreviated form of minute used in informal writing
examples: The recipe takes just 15 min to prepare completely
Wait 5 min before adding the next ingredient please

definitions: tall slender tower of a mosque from which calls to prayer are made
examples: The mosque's minaret rose high above the city skyline
The muezzin climbed the minaret five times each day

definitions: meat that has been cut into very small pieces
examples: She bought fresh mince to make hamburgers for dinner
The recipe calls for lean beef mince and chopped onions

definitions: person responsible for looking after or protecting someone or something
examples: The celebrity's minder kept photographers at a safe distance
She works as a child minder during school holidays

definitions: established set of attitudes or fixed way of thinking held by someone
examples: Success requires a positive mindset and persistent effort daily
The team adopted a growth mindset to overcome challenges

definitions: area containing buried explosive mines
situation presenting many dangers or difficulties
examples: Soldiers carefully cleared the minefield using metal detectors
The abandoned minefield remained dangerous decades after the war
Office politics can be a minefield for new employees
Discussing religion at dinner became a conversational minefield

definitions: person who works in a mine extracting coal or minerals
examples: Coal miners worked long shifts deep underground every day
The gold miner discovered a rich vein of ore

definitions: naturally occurring solid substance with specific chemical composition found in earth
examples: Calcium is an essential mineral for strong bones and teeth
The geology students identified various minerals in rock samples

definitions: ship designed to detect and destroy naval mines
computer puzzle game where players locate hidden mines on a grid
examples: The navy deployed minesweepers to clear the shipping lanes
The old minesweeper was converted into a museum ship
She played minesweeper during her lunch break every day
The classic minesweeper game came preinstalled on the computer

definitions: act of moving around and talking to different people at a social event
examples: The mingling before dinner allowed guests to meet everyone
There was informal mingling during the conference coffee breaks

definitions: something smaller than normal size or miniature version
examples: She drove a mini to save on parking costs
The store sells mini cupcakes perfect for parties

definitions: very detailed small-scale model or representation of something larger
something much smaller than normal of its kind
examples: The museum displayed miniature ships in glass cases
He painted miniatures for the historical wargaming club
The breeder specialized in miniature poodles for apartment living
They collected miniature books smaller than a matchbox

definitions: process of making things very small especially in electronics and technology
examples: The miniaturization of computer chips continues advancing rapidly today
Medical device miniaturization allows for less invasive procedures

definitions: design or lifestyle philosophy emphasizing simplicity and using only essential elements
examples: Their home decor reflected minimalism with clean lines everywhere
She embraced minimalism by reducing possessions to necessities only

definitions: person who practices or advocates minimalism in art, design, or lifestyle
examples: The minimalist artist used only black lines on white
As a minimalist, she owned fewer than fifty items

definitions: act or process of reducing something to the smallest possible amount or degree
examples: Risk minimization strategies protected the company from major losses
The software focuses on cost minimization while maintaining quality

definitions: process or industry of extracting minerals or other materials from the earth
examples: Coal mining provided jobs for generations in the region
Modern mining techniques reduce environmental impact compared to past

definitions: servile follower or subordinate of a powerful person
examples: The villain sent his minions to carry out the plan
Corporate minions executed every order without questioning their boss

definitions: van designed for personal use with multiple rows of seats
examples: The family bought a minivan for their road trip
Soccer moms often drive minivans to transport team members

definitions: small semiaquatic mammal valued for its fur
valuable fur from this animal used in expensive coats
examples: Wild mink hunt fish along rivers and streams
The mink escaped from the fur farm into nature
She inherited her grandmother's vintage mink coat
The auction featured several antique mink stoles

definitions: very small freshwater fish often used as bait
examples: Fishermen caught minnows to use as live bait
Schools of minnows swam in the shallow creek water

definitions: medieval singer or musician who traveled between places performing for money
examples: The minstrel entertained the castle guests with songs and stories
Wandering minstrels spread news between villages in medieval times

definitions: aromatic plant used in cooking and medicine with fresh taste
candy or flavoring with the cool taste of mint plant
place where official coins and medals are manufactured
examples: Fresh mint grows abundantly in the herb garden outside
She added mint leaves to the summer cocktail
The breath mints helped after eating garlic bread
Peppermint candy canes appear during the holiday season
The national mint produces millions of coins each year
The coin was in mint condition from the factory

definitions: slow stately dance in triple time from 17th century French courts
examples: The couple performed a graceful minuet at the ball
Mozart composed many minuets for chamber music performances

definitions: optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions making distant objects appear displaced
examples: Desert travelers often see water mirages on hot days
The shimmering mirage disappeared as they approached closer
